title: Edit a field
content:
The following are the steps to edit a field:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Studio > Fields.

  2. Select the record type in the drop-down list at the top of the page.

  3. Select the field you want to edit. The field properties appear in the right pane.

    To undo your changes at any time before you have saved the record, click Discard.

    1. To edit the field, make the required changes to the properties in the right pane.

      Name This property is read-only.
      Domain This property is read-only.
      System This property is read-only.
      Multilingual label

      The label of the field which Service Management displays in the user interface. This field is required. For locked system fields, the only property that can be edited is Multilingual label. Changes made to the Multilingual label property take effect as soon as you click outside of the property, before you click Save.
      Opposite label If the field is a MANY2MANY association, this property will be the label of the association displayed in the user interface of the target record type.
      Logical type

      The field type. This property is read-only.
      Enable sort If selected, a user may sort the field when it appears in a record list by clicking the column header.
      Enable search

      The user can filter and generate reports using this field. You can define up to two custom fields per record as Enable search.
      Encrypted Only members of the selected encryption domain can view the field if they select it. Only relevant for fields of type MEDIUM_TEXT, LARGE_TEXT, and RICH_TEXT.
      Encryption domain

      Select the encryption domain used for this field. Only appears when Encrypted is selected. For more information on encryption domains, see Encryption domains.
      Enforce uniqueness The value entered in the field must be unique.
      Required This property is read-only.
      Read only Users cannot modify the value of this property.
      Hidden If selected, the field is visible only in the Fields Editor.
      Tooltip The text that appears when you hover over the field.
      Placeholder The text that appears when the field is empty. You can use this to give instructions or reminders to users.
      Target entity If the field is a MANY2MANY association, this property will be the target record type of the association.
      Enable number formatting When selected, number formatting is applied to numeric fields. For example, the system displays 1,000 instead of 1000. Ensure to turn on the Number formatting option in Application settings. For more information on Number formatting, see Number formatting section under Application settings topic.
      Reference to If any of the Logical type fields are ENTITY_LINK, ENUM, or ENUM_SET, provide a reference to the linked entity.

  4. Click Save.

If you have development and production tenants, all configuration changes must be made on the development tenant. For more information about synchronizing the tenants, see Dev2Prod - How to synchronize your development and production tenants.
